diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with a 2-day history of midepigastric pain migrating to the right midabdomen, nausea, and anorexia. Laboratory findings indicated an elevated white blood cell count of 14.2. A CT scan showed a thick-walled, distended gallbladder with multiple large stones, supporting the diagnosis of acute cholecystitis. Additionally, ultrasound findings confirmed a large distended gallbladder with wall edema and stones.
